ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class: learn a lot, would highly recommend.
Great course to get an overview of a variety of topics in public finance.
Highly recommend especially since it covers an array of topics.
Yes, to anyone more or less

Joe is well prepared for class and carefully walks through the various models. The homework, referee report, and presentation are a fair way to assess the course. A bit scattershot in its choice of topics/papers. A good class for applied micro students, and for students outside econ (Forestry, SOM, etc).
I would recommend this course because the readings are interesting and I learned some practical skills.
Very interesting. A must if you are interested in public economics.
Course that asks the most tangible and important questions about economic policy. Highly recommended for anyone who cares about policy.
This course may be interesting for those students, whose research requires an ability to deal with statistics and data analysis.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It probably won't contribute to my dissertation directly, but taught me a lot of new things/improved my understanding of many techniques. Definitely increased my knowledge of public finance.
It gave me an overview of theory and methods in public finance.
Great to here from other researchers in this field.
Exposed to many methods, datasets and subfields. Also learned a lot from the various guest lectures
I feel that this course alerted me to various econometic techniques and methods that I did not know about much before.
Gave frontier examples of the most important methodologies. covered a wide range of topics from which to choose for own specialization.
This course has introduced several major econometric models and some fundamentals of statistic analysis useful for my research.
